think_procedure.step1: Identify the knob in question, which is 'jit' in PostgreSQL.
think_procedure.step2: Understand the function of the 'jit' knob. In PostgreSQL, 'jit' stands for Just-In-Time compilation, which can speed up the execution of certain types of queries.
think_procedure.step3: Determine if the 'jit' knob has any special values. In PostgreSQL, setting 'jit' to 'off' (which is equivalent to 0) disables JIT compilation entirely, which is a different behavior from setting it to a positive value that enables JIT compilation with a specific optimization level.
think_procedure.step4: Conclude that since setting 'jit' to 'off' (0) disables the feature entirely, it behaves differently from setting it to a positive value, making it a special knob.
